column4: how can I get rid of evolution-data-server-1.0 when gnome starts ? I don't need it at all
dependecies telle me that if I uninstall this, it'll uninstall lot of other stuff
damn shit, I'm stuck with keeping this stuff that I don't need
I don't mean to be an idiot but if you want to psychotweak something why are you no using slackware or something
it's more psycho friendly .... I installed ubuntu on this computer (my wife's) because a computer idiot can use it
but I like the ubuntu's Philosophy and want to support them
everything just works (except of course for java but we can fix that)
but stuff like this makes me a little nostalgic about debian
you can support them with cash and still use something else :-)
this distro is an amazing desktop wonder though
